inclusion.criterion: 60-99% stenosis of the internal carotid artery (degree of stenosis assessed by means of Doppler sonography, CT angiography or catheter angiography)
inclusion.label: not_met

inclusion.criterion: diameter of the target internal carotid artery not more than 7 mm
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: symptomatic lesion (a history of ipsilateral stroke, transient ischaemic attack or reversible ischaemic neurological deficit)
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: localisation and morphology of the lesion making possible surgical eversion endarterectomy or endovascular angioplasty with stent implantation
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: target lesion that has been previously stented
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: very tortuous common and internal carotid arteries
exclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: occlusion of the contralateral carotid artery without adequate collateral circulation through the circle of Willis (revealed by means of transcranial Doppler sonography)
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: The patient has a history of CAD, but no other cardiovascular risk factors. He is physically active and has normal levels of fasting glucose and triglycerides.
